ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT:
DIRECTIONS for questions 1 and 2: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

A fruit vendor purchased a basket of 80 apples and found that 15 of them were rotten and could not be sold. What is the discount that he should offer on each of the remaining apples after marking them up by 40% each, so as to make an overall profit of 10%? (approximately)

DIRECTIONS for questions 1 and 2: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

Last year, Ajay’s age was thrice Vijay’s age. If the ratio of the sum and the difference of their present ages is 13 : 6, after how many years from now will Ajay’s age be twice Vijay’s age?

DIRECTIONS for questions 4 to 7: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

A two-digit number is four times the sum of its digits and two times the product of its digits. How many such numbers are possible?

DIRECTIONS for questions 4 to 7: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

If Rahul marked his goods 50% above cost price and then sold them after giving two successive discounts of 10% and 20%, what is his profit percentage?
DIRECTIONS for questions 4 to 7: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

DIRECTIONS for questions 4 to 7: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

Consider the set S = {1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 7, 8, 9, 10}. Find the number of subsets of S which contain at least seven elements and include exactly one among ‘5’ and ‘9’.

DIRECTIONS for question 8: Type in your answer in the input box provided below the question.

The area of a rectangle is 391 sq. units. If the rectangle becomes a square after its length is decreased by 4 units and its breadth is increased by 2 units, find the decrease in the area (in sq.units) of the rectangle.

DIRECTIONS for questions 9 and 10: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

While typing a book, Raju, a typist, spotted that N consecutive pages, starting from the Kth page, were not numbered and he found the sum of the page numbers of these pages to be 100. Which among the following CANNOT be the value of K?
ENGLISH.OPT4: More than one of the above

ENGLISH.QUESTION_TEXT:
DIRECTIONS for questions 9 and 10: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

Two cars, A and B, simultaneously started from City P to City Q and from City Q to City P respectively and met each other on the way at 1:00 p.m. If A and B reached their destinations at 7:00 p.m. and 3:40 p.m. respectively, then at what time did they start?

DIRECTIONS for question 11: Type in your answer in the input box provided below the question.

Find the area (in sq.units) of the region enclosed by the graphs of the equations x2 = 18 and y2 = 50.

DIRECTIONS for questions 12 and 13: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

There are seven numbers, a1, a2, a3, a4, a5, a6 and a7, such that, for i = 1, 2, 3, 4 and 5, the sum ai + ai + 1 + ai +2 is 1, if i is odd, and −1, if i is even. Also, a6 + a7 + a1 = −1 and a7 + a1 + a2 = 1. Find (a4, a7).

DIRECTIONS for questions 12 and 13: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

A shopkeeper has a faulty balance, in which the two pans have unequal weights. With this balance, he weighs 10 kg of rice. However, the customer insists that the rice be kept in the other pan and weighed. The weight of the rice then turns out to be 8 kg. Find the actual weight of the rice.

DIRECTIONS for questions 14 and 15: Type in your answer in the input box provided below the question.

If A = {14, −11, 19, 11, 7, 41, 16, 23}, find the average of the averages of all the possible triplets of numbers taken from the given set A.

DIRECTIONS for questions 14 and 15: Type in your answer in the input box provided below the question.

Four positive numbers are in the ratio 2 : 4 : 6 : 9. If sum of their squares is equal to 1233, then find the second highest number.

DIRECTIONS for questions 16 to 19: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

If x2 − 5x + 6 = 0 and x2 − ax +12 = 0 have a root in common, find the minimum value of a.

DIRECTIONS for questions 16 to 19: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

A watch salesman started his day with 11 identical watches. During the first hour of the day, he visited exactly four people and sold at least one watch. In how many ways could he have sold the watches during the first hour of the day?

DIRECTIONS for questions 16 to 19: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

Vicky wants to purchase some pencils and pens by spending exactly Rs.210. If a pencil and a pen cost Rs.5 and Rs.8 each respectively, and the number of pens purchased is more than the number of pencils purchased, then in how many different combinations can Vicky purchase the items?

DIRECTIONS for question 20: Type in your answer in the input box provided below the question.

There is a circle in the x-y plane with its centre at the point C = (a, b) and radius 6 units. If a and b are integers, how many points with integer co-ordinates do not lie outside the circle?

DIRECTIONS for questions 21 to 28: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

Fresh berries contain 72% water, while dry berries contain 18% water. What quantity of dry berries can be obtained from 41 kg of fresh berries?

DIRECTIONS for questions 21 to 28: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

A function f (x, y) is said to be a linear function, if it is of the form ax + by + c. If a linear function f (x, y) is such that, f (2, k) ≥ f (3, k); f (5, k) ≥ f (4, k) and f (6, k) = 10, find the value of f (7, k).
DIRECTIONS for questions 21 to 28: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

DIRECTIONS for questions 21 to 28: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

A sum takes five years to become three times itself under simple interest, at a certain rate of interest. If it was lent at the same interest rate under compound interest, interest being compounded annually, then in how many years will the sum become more than five times itself?

DIRECTIONS for questions 21 to 28: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

A boy starts to paint a fence on one day. On the second day, two more boys join him. On the third day, three more boys join the group, on the fourth day four more boys join the group and so on. If the fence is completely painted this way in exactly 20 days, find the number of days in which 10 men painting together can paint the fence completely, given that each man can paint twice as fast as a boy can.

DIRECTIONS for questions 21 to 28: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

ABCD is a trapezium in which AB CD, AB = 12 cm and CD = 24 cm. If O is the point of intersection of AC and BD, find the ratio of the area of triangle AOD to that of triangle COD.

DIRECTIONS for questions 21 to 28: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

If 5a2 + 9b2 + 9c2 = 6a (2b + c), which of the following statements is/are necessarily true?

I.b = 2c

II. 2a = 3b

In a 400 m race, Ravi gives Bharath a headstart of 40 m and beats him by 40 m. If Ravi completed the race in 20 seconds, what is the speed of Bharath?

The work done by two men in six days is equal to the work done by four women in nine days. How many women are required to do a piece of work in 32 days, if 12 men could do the same piece of work in 48 days?

DIRECTIONS for questions 33 and 34: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

The curves b = log10 a and b = a−1 are drawn in the a − b plane. How many times do they intersect for a ≥1?

DIRECTIONS for questions 33 and 34: Select the correct alternative from the given choices.

In a class, when the students were asked about their preferences of three fruits − Apple, Banana and Mango, 78% of them liked at least one among the three fruits. 50% of the class liked apples, 30% liked bananas and 20% liked mangoes. If 6% of the students in the class liked all the three fruits, what percentage of the students in the class liked more than one fruit?
